credit_line: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane
title: Window Decoration, Probably for the East Wall of the Music Room
medium: Watercolor, graphite on white wove paper
description:
Horizontal rectangle. Design for the Royal Pavilion, Brighton. Elevation of the east wall, showing a design for the decoration of the five windows which comprise this wall. Festoons of patterned and fringed drapery are held in place by carved snakes. On the piers between the windows are fluted draperies radiating from a central flower, and vertical folds. Carved cornice above.

Original album associated with this collection still exists.  See 1948-40-1 accessory
name: Drawing
